title: How much size does a 48 megapixel mobile photograph occupy? - Quora

response.answer_text: The typical phones out there, using default JPEG settings, deliver 10–16 MB files for their 48 megapixel mode images. Most phones offer the ability to select quality options for JPEG shooting, so I’d expect you have some ability to trade quality for storage efficiency. A raw image would run 48–60+ MB, without any sort of compression (lossy or lossless). An 8-bit TIF would run around 150MB without any (lossless) compression.

If you’re asking about printed size, then it depends on the DPI output you select to determine print quality. But typically people print out about 300 dpi and that would yield about an 18 x 27” bread. If you’re asking about printed size, then it depends on the dpi output you select to determine print quality. But typically people print at about 300 dpi and that would yield about an 18 x 27“ print.
